title: Daddojanam / Curd/ yogurt Rice || Temple prasadam || Navratri
content:
Easy temple prasadam recipe : Daddojanam/ Curd Rice üçö¬† Servings : 3 Duration : 10 mins Daddojnam is known as Curd/ Yogurt rice which is famous in India üáÆüá≥ It is offered to God/ Godess in temples which is delicious and tasty. You can also prepare at home when you get bore of eating normal rice& dal. Mainly this curd rice contains fresh homemade curd/ yogurt with tempering, hing, peppercorns/ crushed pepper powder and coriander leaves Nutrition facts of Curd: Vitamins : A, C , B6 & B 12 Minerals : Iron, calcium, sodium & magnesium¬† It has good protein¬† To make perfect daddojanam/ Curd rice follow below steps: Note:
  1. Use fresh homemade curd/ yogurt
  2. Do not use sour curd/ yogurt
  3. Use freshly cooked rice for best results
  4. Do not mix curd in hot rice
Today, I prepared daddojanam to offer Godess Durga mata which is popular in Andhra Pradesh, India and also regular temple prasadam in temples. Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: Cooked Rice - 1 bowl Curd - 235ml Milk - 120 ml Oil - 1 tbsp Salt - 1 tsp Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp Cumin seeds - 1 tsp Urad Dal - 2 tsp Bengal gram - 2 tsp Curry leaves - chopped - 6 Green chillies - 2 - finely chopped Hing/ Asafoetida - 1/4 tsp Pepper powder - Coarse - 1/2 tsp ( You can also pepper corns) Coriander / cilantro - chopped - 1/2 cup Procedure:
  • Heat skillet pan on medium heat
  • Add 1 tbsp oil in pan
  • Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, Urad Dal and Bengal gram
  • Saute them & splutter
  • Add green chillies, curry leaves
  • Add hing, coarse pepper powder
  • Saute them
  • Swith off burner/ Cook top
  • Add this tempering on cooked rice
  • Add salt, milk and fresh curd on rice
  • Mix well
  • Add chopped coriander leaves
  • Mix well
  • Offer this daddojanam to Godess Durga Mata
  • You can serve it with mango pickle in lunch/ dinner
  • Enjoy your day & Happy Cooking üòä
